meanings.sent1: The family reunion was a multigenerational event, with grandparents, parents, and children all coming together.
meanings.sent2: The multigenerational household included grandparents, parents, and grandchildren living under one roof.
meanings.sent3: The multigenerational picnic had games for all ages, from toddlers to seniors.
meanings.sent4: The multigenerational tree in the park symbolized the interconnectedness of different age groups.
meanings.sent5: The multigenerational photo captured four generations of the family, from great-grandparents to newborns.

meanings.definition: Lasting for or spanning multiple generations.
meanings.sent1: The multigenerational tradition of baking cookies together on holidays continued for decades.
meanings.sent2: The multigenerational impact of the historical event was felt by descendants for years to come.
meanings.sent3: The multigenerational story of the old house was passed down through the family with each new generation.
meanings.sent4: The multigenerational curse in the legend haunted the family for centuries.
meanings.sent5: The multigenerational commitment to education ensured that knowledge was passed down through the ages.
